title: An Allegory: Design for a Book Illustration
medium: pen, brown ink and bistre wash
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff
provenance_text:
Gabriel de Saint-Aubin [1724-1780], Paris, France. Alfred Beurdeley [1847-1919], Paris, France [1]; sale, Galerie Georges Petit, Paris, France, March 13, 1905 to March 15, 1905, no. 230 [2]. Seiferheld & Co., New York, NY [3]; Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff, Colonia, NJ, likely by June 1974 but by May 1976, until December 9, 1976 [4]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1976 [5].

[1]. Born Emmanuel-Alfred Beurdeley; also known as Alfred II Beurdeley (Lugt 421.) 
[2]. See curatorial file for copies of relevant pages from the sale "Catalogue des dessins, aquarelles, gouaches des écoles française et anglaise du XVIIIe siècle, miniatures, composant la collection de M. A. Beurdeley." This drawing, entitled "Allégorie," is illustrated in the catalogue.
[3]. Seiferheld and Co. label affixed to the back of frame. 
[4]. See correspondence in collector file. Several other works in the Fishkoff collection have also passed through the Seiferheld gallery in NYC, which was active throughout the 1960s under various names.
[5]. The drawing was accessioned on December 9, 1976.

creator.birth_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
creator.death_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
